content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice and clear

Title
* Please use a proper, descriptive title that accurately reflects the clash.

Goal
* The sentence "He'll eat either food A or food B" is misleading. In fact, Ethan may eat either type or both. Please revise the wording.

* Please state that [[ca]] and [[cb]] must be non-negative integers.

Input
* Please replace "final" with "target".

Output
* Please change "answers" to "options".

* Please specify that [[ca]] and [[cb]] should be output on a separate line. Better yet, refer to the example on https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement , and use a structure like this for clarity:

If Ethan can reach the target [[T]]:
<<Line 1>>: {{YES}}
<<Line 2>>: Two space-separated integers [[ca]] and [[cb]], representing (…followed by more description)

Otherwise:
<<Line 1>>: {{NO}}

Game modes
* The requirement may be difficult to infer in Reverse mode. Consider disabling this mode.

Cases
* Please use meaningful and relevant titles for all test cases. Avoid names such as "HEHEHEHA".

* Please remove the trailing newlines from both the input and the output of every case.

* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario. Please update the cases as follows:

  • Swap Validator 1 with Test 3

  • Revise Test 4 so that its value of T is closer in magnitude to Validator 4, while remaining within the constraints. Also ensure that ca > 0 and cb > 0.

* Please create a new pair of cases where a > 100, b > 100, T > 100, ca = 0 and cb > 0.

Thanks.

Summary of the remaining issues:

* Rename the clash.

* Address all items listed under "Cases" in my previous comment.

* (Optional, but recommended) Restructure the Output section as suggested in my previous comment for improved clarity.

Thanks.
Are the clash title and the case names clear too?
